full_summary:
Title
================
ICPM - Community Maintenance Program-Multi Target (CMP-MT) and Community Maintenance Program - Sex Offender (CMP-SO)

Tender Announcement
-------------------

**ICPM** (Integrated Correctional Program Model) is a requirement for the Correctional Service of Canada (CSC) to deliver programs to offenders in the Moncton, Fredericton, and Saint John, New Brunswick areas. The successful candidate will provide program services to offenders referred by the CSC.

Key Dates
----------

*   Publication Date: 2022-11-29
*   Tender Closing Date: 2023-01-13T13:00:00
*   Amendment Date: 2022-12-01

Solicitation Details
---------------------

*   Solicitation Number: 21280-23-4190402
*   Trade Agreement: None
*   Competitive Procurement Strategy: Lowest Priced Compliant Bid
*   Set-aside under the Procurement Strategy for Indigenous Business: None
*   Comprehensive Land Claim Agreement: None
*   Security Requirements: This standing offer includes security requirements.

Procurement Information
----------------------

*   Procurement Category: Service (SRV)
*   Procurement Method: Competitive - Open Bidding
*   Regions of Opportunity: New Brunswick
*   Regions of Delivery: New Brunswick
*   Contracting Entity: Correctional Service of Canada
*   Contact Information:
    *   Name: Jolaine Amos
    *   Email: <jolaine.amos@csc-scc.gc.ca>
    *   Phone: 506-269-3787

Description of Requirements
-------------------------

The CSC requires the delivery of programs to offenders who have completed an ICPM program or have participated in the former cadre of Correctional Programs. The programs are designed to:

*   Refine core self-management skills and apply them to real-life situations, obstacles, and high-risk situations to reduce risk to re-offend.
*   Review and refine skills for moderate or high-risk offenders.

Deliverables
------------

*   Provide delivery and delivery space of the requested number of ICPM sessions (CMP MT or CMP SO) to offenders referred by CSC.
*   Obtain necessary program materials and prepare lesson plans.
*   Complete program interim and final reports within (8) working days from the last day of the Offender's attendance and input data into the CSC Offender Management System (OMS).
